module.field:
This Validation Summary Report (VSR) is created to summarize testing results for the following Siemens Polarion initiatives in the QA environment for <Company Name or Site Name>: 

·       New Polarion implementation for <Company Name or Site Name>.

·       Polarion infrastructure and software version upgrade (from 18.3 to 21R1) for <Company Name or Site Name>.

Initial version of this document includes qualification results in the QA environment.

The acceptance criteria, as defined in the Polarion <Company Name or Site Name> Validation Plan and Polarion <Company Name or Site Name> Qualification Protocol established the requirements to be met prior to the closure of the qualification activities.  This document is an Interim VSR and will be revised to version 2.0 to capture IQ testing results in the Production environment.

Polarion <Company Name or Site Name> is/are qualified for their intended use and when the <Company Name or Site Name> IT change request is approved, cutover activities can be started within the approved planned window.  Note, the version 2.0 VSR must be approved before the production system can go live.

The following acceptance criteria defined in the Validation Plan and Qualification Protocol have been met:

·       All QA testing has been executed and documented in this Validation Summary Report

·       The <Company Name or Site Name> IT Change Management Work Instruction is being followed for this implementation   

 

As defined in the Validation Plan, the scope of this validation was to:

·       Validate Polarion <Company Name or Site Name> for its intended use.

·       Regression test of Polarion.

All validation deliverables included in the Validation Plan have been completed as defined. The following table includes a listing of all validation deliverables generated during this validation:

This deliverable is a validated live report.  This report has been exported and is attached to this VSR. Any text not displayed in full in the exported report is available within the live report / work item Polarion.

<Company Name>: Thirty-four (34) defects were found during the execution of qualification testing. Two (2) Defects will remain Open.

        11Defects 

        <Company Name>: Twelve (12) defects were found during the execution of qualification testing. One (1) Defect will remain Open.

        12Defects 

  

  Defect ID
OQ
 
Description
Rationale for production use
3459
OQ_User Needs, Intended Use, Marketing Claims and Regulatory Management
 OQ Failure for Permissions Issue and Workflow Configuration in User Needs, Intended Use, Marketing Claims and Regulatory Management.
 The issue will be fixed during Hypercare and does not have a business impact.
3458
OQ_Test Method Management
 OQ Failure for Permissions Issue and Wokrflow Configuration in Test Method Management.
 The issue will be fixed during Hypercare and does not have a business impact.
3209
N/A.
 Exported PDF doesn't have company logo.
 The issue will be fixed during Hypercare and does not have a business impact. This is a known issue during QA and the scripts to fix will be updated Post GoLive.


  • The Design Review document uploaded into Polarion did not take checkboxes for (Yes/No/N/A) in the Deliverables Summary. The three listed Deliverables (System Risk Assessment, GxP Applicability Assessment, System Requirements Specification) are all completed and approved.
  • The current version of System Requirements Specification (SRS) does not include Requirement IDs in its printable view. However, every requirement in the document has a unique, system generated Requirement ID which appears in work item view and the Traceability Matrix. This current “display” setting will be updated to show Requirement ID by each system requirement specification and the document with Requirement IDs will be routed for review.  The version 2.0 SRS will be approved before the version 2.0 VSR is approved.
  • Validation Plan included an incorrect Test Rating and Testing Type table. This was an inadvertent authoring error by the Validation Lead. Polarion CSA template does have accurate risk rating and testing type configurations, which was what  were used for test execution. See Appendix 1 for corrected Test Rating and Testing Type Table.

The Validation Plan may be closed through a version 2.0 VSR once the following conditions are satisfied.  Note, the version 2.0 VSR must be approved before the production system can go live.

  • All Validation deliverables identified in the Validation Plan have been completed and approved. Any exceptions and / or clarifications have been documented appropriately in the version 2.0 VSR. 
  • All documentation has been reviewed and approved, including the version 2.0 SRS with Requirement IDs
  • All training materials have been created and user training is complete.
  • All standard operating procedures and/or work instructions have been written and approved
  • The IT Change Management Work Instruction is being followed for this implementation
  • The version 2.0 VSR has been written and approved with justifications and / or rationale for fit for intended use, as applicable. 
  • All users who will have access to the production system at go live, have had hands-on training and are experienced users of the system (have been using the System both in Dev and QA environments and were involved in testing the configuration content).  New users will be required to train on the Polarion work instruction for basic access to the system, as well as hands-on training prior to project access/assignments. 
  • All work instructions have been written and approved.  On the advice of document control, a standard operating procedure was not written. 
      • Polarion Use for <Company Name>
      • Polarion Configuration and Administration

  • All required IQ testing was successfully completed.
  • All required OQ / UAT testing was successfully completed.
  • All testing related issues / defects during IQ/OQ/UAT qualification have been logged and resolved except for the 2 open defects documented in section 6.1.

  • All required IQ testing in Production was successfully completed.
  • All testing related issues / defects during IQ Production qualification have been logged and resolved except for the 3 open defects documented in section 6.1.

Approval of this document concludes this version of this document validation effort in Qualification (QA) environment and when the IT change request is approved, cutover activities can be started within the approved planned window.

       Approval of this version 2 of Report will allow the systems for continued Business use.

Attachment 1: CSA_Template_Reports_Requirement_Traceability_Matrix.pdf

#documentPanel(true "approved")
